noun.description: In singular and plural Lands lying in or towards the south.

adjective.description: Of, from, or belonging to the southern part of a country or region or lands laying to the south.

origin: Old English; earliest use found in Old English Hexateuch: General. From the uninflected (originally adverb) stem of south + land. Compare Middle High German sūdenlant (German Südland), Old Icelandic suðrland.
